reqs:
Pre-reqs: One of BIOL 230, GEOB 207, FRST 202.
Note: This is a wait list for GEOB 307, section 201, Term 2. You will be moved into active registration if space becomes available. Wait list does not guarantee placement in this course.
description: Biogeographic concepts in understanding responses in ecosystems to environmental change at global, regional, and local scales. Conservation issues such as the loss of biodiversity and endangered species.
